page.title: 17A FARMWORKER'S YEAR
page.content: The morning starts by herding the cows to the milking parlour to be milked by the machine.After that they are taken to the field.The same worker will either cut the grass or turn it so that the sun dries it and makes hay. Most of the summer is spent in the fields making hay and silage.In the Autumn the harvest will begin and the ground will be fertilised.If the land has been used for crops they will then plough.In Winter the cows are kept in stalls and the farmworker has to fill the feeding troughs every day with silage and hay.The cows are bedded on straw which is kept in a big barn.To clean the yard the cows are herded to one end then a small tractor with a scraper scapes up the muck, which is then stored in a slurry pit for use later.
